docs.text: this movie stinks !
docs.label: negative

docs.text: although it is professionally crafted and there are some decent performances , the plot is so bad it drags the film into the abyss .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i knew i was in for trouble when , during the opening establishment shots , we see a detailed close-up of warrant officer paul brenner's ( john travolta ) military identification card and it is the wrong color .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: this might seem like a minor detail , but anyone who has spent anytime with the military knows that active duty identification cards are green and dependant cards are yellow .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: and what about the senior military officer whose uniform shirt is so wrinkled he looks like he is a recruit on his first day of training .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: or what about when brenner tells a suspect that , because he is in the military , he doesn't have the right not to answer his questions even though these rights were central to military law well before the miranda decision .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: how hard is it to get someone familiar with the military to check these facts ?
docs.label: negative

docs.text: now details like this could be overlooked if the underlying story held up , but this story is so full of holes it is painful to sit through .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: for example , at the beginning of the film , paul brenner , an undercover army investigator , gets into a gun and knife battle at his off-post houseboat and winds-up killing an arms dealer he had been investigating .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the local police investigating the death are openly hostile to the military and they discover that brenner has been lying to them about the killing .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: but instead of arresting him , or at least take him into custody for further questioning , they release him .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: duh !
docs.label: negative

docs.text: ultimately , brenner gets assigned to investigate the murder and possible rape of the commanding general's daughter , a young captain also assigned to the post .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: when brenner finds graphic sex tapes featuring the general's daughter , does he use them to generate a suspect list and begin grilling suspects .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: no , his instinct is to suppress them because they might be potentially embarrassing .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: eventually , brenner discovers that this murder is related to a violent gang rape at west point eight years earlier .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i won't even go into the totally unbelievable rationale for the army's suppression of this horrendous crime .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i will just mention one final flaw .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: brenner is investigating a crime that occurred in georgia .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the rape occurred in west point , which is in new york .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: he is under a very tight ( and totally implausible ) 36-hour deadline to solve this case .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: he needs to discuss the rape with a psychiatrist at west point .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: does he phone the doctor ?
docs.label: negative

docs.text: no , he travels ( via some unexplained very fast transport ) to new york to question the psychiatrist in person , and then he returns to georgia ( again by the miracle transport ) , without once worrying about the impact any of this will have on his deadline .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: you have been warned , stay away from this one .
docs.label: negative
